metadata.title: CVE-2022-20166 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In various methods of kernel base drivers, there is a possible out ofbounds write due to a heap buffer overflow. This could lead to localescalation of privilege with System execution privileges needed. Userinteraction is not needed for exploitation.Product: AndroidVersions:Android kernelAndroid ID: A-182388481References: Upstream kernel

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-20166` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-105-generic - 5.4.0-105.119~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-105-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-105.119~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-105-lowlatency - 5.4.0-105.119~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-105-generic - 5.4.0-105.119~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-105-lowlatency - 5.4.0-105.119~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1069-aws - 5.4.0-1069.73~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1073-azure - 5.4.0-1073.76~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1068-gcp - 5.4.0-1068.72~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1066-gke - 5.4.0-1066.69~18.04.1
No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/bionic is affected and needs fixing.
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-105.119~18.04.1').
linux-kvm package in esm-infra/bionic is affected and needs fixing.
linux-aws package in esm-infra/bionic is affected and needs fixing.
